page.title: 12VILLAGE PEOPLE
page.content: {We interviewed Miss Greenwood of {Garvestone whose mother was a {headmistress of the school. Q:Where did you used to live? A:While my mother was the head we lived in the school. Q:Where did you sleep in the school? A:In the room upstairs which is now Mrs Foyster's room. Q:What changes have you noticed in the school? A:What is now the wood shed used to be a lavatory.The rooms upstairs were the school house bedrooms. Before the dividing wall was knocked down the library used to be two rooms i.e. a lounge and a living room. The ground on which the mobile now stands used to be waste ground.{ {Note:the old hand pump from which {water was obtained in the very early {days is still here.
